title.narrative: National appeal 'Samen in actie voor Beiroet'

description.narrative: Cash assistance for small businesses. Cash assistance and rehabilitation works for damaged houses. Psychosocial support for children and caregivers.

title.narrative: Number of people provided with resources to protect and start rebuilding livelihood assets

description.narrative:
1- Conduct vulnerability assessment to identify micro-businesses affected by Beirut explosion and in need for rehabilitation services
Description of Activity: To select beneficiaries who have micro-businesses from our previous vulnerability assessment database (conducted one month ago by WVL). If target was not reached for beneficiary selection, additional vulnerability assessment via phone calls will be done by enumerators/ Casual workers and WVL staff to select affected micro-businesses from the vulnerability list.
2- Conduct technical assessment to identify rehabilitation needs and prepare BoQs
3- Sign a cash for rehabilitation contract with beneficiary (Business owner): Cash will be provided to impacted micro-businesses for necessary rehabilitation works based on payment milestones
4- Rehabilitation works are initiated by the business owner (beneficiary) where payments will be finazlized as per MoU
5- Inspection for completion of work
6- Finalize the payment with the beneficiary upon completion and approval of the rehabilitation work

title.narrative: Number of people provided with non-food items

description.narrative: 1- Conduct vulnerability assessment to identify vulnerability score and eligibility for damaged home appliances 2- Based on the eligibility and the scoring, identify whether the HH will benefit from 300 USD cash assistance or 600 USD cash assistance depending on the number of damaged appliances. 3- For assistance (up to 600$): Sign a cash for shelter contract with beneficiary (house owner): Cash will be provided to impacted households for necessary purchases based on the agreement 4- Finalize the payment with the beneficiary or contractor upon completion and approval of the purchasing and collection of MOVs

title.narrative: Number of people having access to basic, safe and dignified shelters solutions

description.narrative:
1- Conduct vulnerability assessment to identify vulnerability score and eligibility for the technical assessment
2- Conduct technical assessment to identify beneficiaries' needs in relation to shelter, water and sanitation services. Households with minor and major rehabilitation works will be targeted.
3- Rehabilitation of households including but not limited to doors repair/ replacement, windows repair/ replacement, damaged walls, ceilings, and others.
4- Rehabilitation of damaged water supply at household level/ building including but not limited to piping restauration etc …
5- Rehabilitation of damaged sanitation services at household level/ building including but not limited to pipes, toilets, shower, and sinks.
6- On ground assessment and preparation of BoQs are conducted by the engineer
7- For minor rehabilitations (up to 600$): Sign a cash for rehabilitation contract with beneficiariy (house owner): Cash will be provided to impacted households for necessary rehabilitation works based on payment milestones
8- For major rehabilitations: Hand over to the selected contractor through WVL's tender process
9- Rehabilitation works are initiated by: the house owner (beneficiary) for minor rehabilitations whereby payments are provided based on rehabilitation works done. or by the contractor for major rehabilitations (payment based on contract)
10- Finalize the payment with the beneficiary or contractor upon completion and approval of the rehabilitation works.

title.narrative: Number of children that received support specified to their needs

description.narrative:
Distribute Child Protection/PSS activity sheets with specific CP/PSS and COVID-19 topics and activities that caregivers can conduct together with their children.
Follow-up through a WhatsApp group and calls with caregivers on progress through weekly calls and support will take place to disseminate important messages on CP and MHPSS and receive feedback on their progress with working on the activity sheets with their children.
Main Components of CP/PSS activity sheets: - Activity sheets include topics for children on interpersonal skills, coping skills, CP needs, and others - Activity sheets include topics for caregivers on positive parenting, infographics on COVID-19, stigma and discrimination, coping with distress, and others - Follow up calls to be done remotely with caregivers receiving these activity sheets to follow up on the progress and challenges of implementation of activity sheets with their children.

title.narrative: Number of persons who receive an appropriate response

description.narrative:
Provide Psychological First Aid (PFA) and Psycho-Social Support (PSS) to caregivers and children affected by the explosion on the basis of an assessment to understand their psychosocial and emotional needs to address important MHPSS and CHPA topics and refer girls, boys, women and men to specialized services (if needed incl provision of emergency cash assistance for transportation to services)
Main Components: - PSS sessions to be provided for caregivers remotely once per week through whatsapp for a total of 8 to 12 sessions (recharge cards will be distributed) - PSS sessions to be provided for children face to face either in the center or at their homes once per week for a total of 10 to 12 sessions - PFA calls will be provided based on beneficiaries' needs and requests. - Emergency cash assistance for transportation to be provided for high risk cases referred to specialized service

title.narrative: Number of participants showing an increased knowledge on the protection subject in focus

description.narrative: Provide required capacity building and coaching on remote PFA and remote PSS to partners and staff to ensure quality implementation. Build the capacity of staff, volunteers and community-based organizations on MHPSS, CPHA, Early Identification and Safe Referrals and other related topics based on needs and follow up through ongoing coaching by technical staff
